summary: The document examines a report concerning the yacht Potomac, historically used by Presidents Theodore Roosevelt and F.D. Roosevelt, which was allegedly repurposed by the Alpha 66 organization for transporting weapons disguised as Argentine beef. Key figures mentioned include Wes Davis and Cliff Roberts. The yacht, later found in poor condition in Barbados and subsequently moved to San Diego, was acquired by Hydra-Capital, Inc. The report's reliability is doubted due to its vague details and questionable origin.
key_findings: Allegation of the yacht Potomac's use by Alpha 66 for weapon transport under the guise of Argentine beef.
Involvement of individuals Wes Davis and Cliff Roberts with the yacht.
Historical significance of the yacht as a presidential vessel for Theodore Roosevelt and F.D. Roosevelt.
Discovery of the yacht in Barbados in a deteriorated state before relocation to San Diego.
Doubts regarding the report's credibility stemming from its ambiguous information and source.
